definitions.definition: to enter a country by force with large numbers of soldiers in order to take possession of it:
examples: Concentrations of troops near the border look set to invade within the next few days.

definitions.definition: to enter a place in large numbers, usually when unwanted and in order to take possession or do damage:
examples: Hundreds of squatters have invaded waste land in the hope that they will be allowed to stay.

definitions.definition: to enter an area of activity in a forceful and noticeable way:
examples: Maria looks set to invade the music scene with her style and image.

definitions.definition: to spoil a situation or quality for another person without thinking about their feelings:
examples: Famous people often find their privacy is invaded by the press.
